CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Ticket Purchase stage positioned above or below the Post-Event Feedback stage?
SRP.A: The Ticket Purchase stage is positioned {above} the Post-Event Feedback stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Reattendance?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Reattendance is {257}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Announcement?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Announcement is {1878}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Attendance?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Attendance is {817}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Event Announcement, with a value of {1878}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Event Reattendance, with a value of {257}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback?
SC.A: Decreased by {216} Participants from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Merchandise Purchase to stage Event Reattendance?
SC.A: Decreased by {49} Participants from stage Merchandise Purchase to stage Event Reattendance.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 1543? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 281? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 315 and 678? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Fan Engagement} stage has {540}, the {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {324}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance, or from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to {Event Attendance} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance, or from stage Event Announcement to Ticket Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Announcement} to {Ticket Purchase} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Attendance} to stage {Fan Engagement} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance, from stage Merchandise Purchase to Event Reattendance, or from stage Event Announcement to Ticket Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Announcement} to stage {Ticket Purchase} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Event Announcement} and {Ticket Purchase} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Event Feedback} and {Merchandise Purchase} stages.
